q: How effective are flood panels for homes in coastal Miami?
a:
High-grade aluminum flood panels rated to ASTM E330 withstand hydrostatic pressures typical of Category 3 surge zones. When anchored correctly, they prevent water intrusion up to 36 inches above threshold. For coastal Miami, we recommend sealing gaskets and stainless hardware to resist salt corrosion.

q: Do I need a building permit to install flood panels in Miami-Dade County?
a: Permanent track or anchor installations generally require a short-form permit under the 'flood protection device' category. Removable panels that use existing openings are exempt. We coordinate permitting with Miami-Dade's Building Code Section 3109 to ensure compliance.

Most residential systems install in one working day once openings are measured. Larger multi-opening properties may require 2–3 days. Each panel system is pre-cut and pressure-tested before delivery to minimize on-site time.

q: What maintenance is required after a storm?
a: Rinse all components with fresh water, remove salt residue, and inspect gasket compression tracks. Store panels vertically in a dry area. Annual hardware checks maintain FEMA P-203 compliance.

q: Can one person deploy the panels before a storm?
a: Yes. Each 48-inch aluminum panel weighs roughly 14 lb. A single homeowner can secure a door or window bay in 3–5 minutes using quick-lock clamps supplied with the kit.

q: Are Miami flood panels approved by insurance carriers?
a: Most carriers recognize certified systems as mitigation devices and may discount wind-and-flood premiums 5–10%. Always submit the product's engineering certificate during policy renewal.

q: How do panels compare with sandbags?
a: Panels provide sealed, reusable protection without introducing contaminated sand or mold risk. They deploy faster and store compactly.

q: What is the expected service life?
a: Marine-grade aluminum panels typically last 20–25 years with annual gasket replacement every 5 years in salt-air environments.

q: Do you offer emergency installation before storms?
a: Yes. Our rapid-response team can fit pre-engineered openings within 24–48 hours before forecasted events, subject to availability.
